channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Battle of Chinese and Taiwanese Chatbots and a Balloon Battle Between the Koreas
item.description:
Taiwan has developed a large language model artificial intelligence chat bot to compete with a product from China because of fears regarding national security. And North Korea sends garbage-filled balloons over the border into South Korea, escalating a long-standing balloon battle between the Koreas.

Sign up for State of the World+ to listen sponsor-free and support the work of NPR journalists. Visit plus.npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
Taiwan has developed a large language model artificial intelligence chat bot to compete with a product from China because of fears regarding national security. And North Korea sends garbage-filled balloons over the border into South Korea, escalating a long-standing balloon battle between the Koreas.

Sign up for State of the World+ to listen sponsor-free and support the work of NPR journalists. Visit plus.npr.org.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: How the pandemic gave power to superbugs
item.description: A surprising outcome of the COVID pandemic has been the rise of antibiotic-resistant infections. How did that happen?
item.content:encoded:
A surprising outcome of the COVID pandemic has been the rise of antibiotic-resistant infections. How did that happen?

(Image credit: -)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: American Airlines faces a discrimination suit after removing 8 Black men from flight
item.description: Neither passenger knew each other, nor were they seated together on the Jan. 5 flight from Phoenix to New York. A lawsuit alleges they were removed from the flight after a complaint about body odor.
item.content:encoded:
Neither passenger knew each other, nor were they seated together on the Jan. 5 flight from Phoenix to New York. A lawsuit alleges they were removed from the flight after a complaint about body odor.

(Image credit: Kiichiro Sato)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Franklin

item.title: Gangs mix another potent sedative into U.S. street drugs causing 'mass overdoses'
item.description: Medetomidine, a chemical long used by veterinarians and doctors, is now turning up in the street drug supply and triggering a new wave of overdoses.
item.content:encoded:
Medetomidine, a chemical long used by veterinarians and doctors, is now turning up in the street drug supply and triggering a new wave of overdoses.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Trump verdict would likely move only a small number of votes, poll finds
item.description: A guilty or not-guilty verdict wouldn't change many voters minds, but it could make a difference for a smaller, crucial group of voters this election.
item.content:encoded:
A guilty or not-guilty verdict wouldn't change many voters minds, but it could make a difference for a smaller, crucial group of voters this election.

(Image credit: Stephanie Keith)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Justice Alito declines to recuse himself in Jan. 6-related cases
item.description: In two letters, Alito said it was his wife’s decision to fly two politically contentious flags, adding that neither he nor his wife was aware of the modern political connotations associated with the flags.
item.content:encoded:
In two letters, Alito said it was his wife’s decision to fly two politically contentious flags, adding that neither he nor his wife was aware of the modern political connotations associated with the flags.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Should you lend money to your loved ones? NPR listeners weigh in
item.description: Our audience shares their perspective on the tricky etiquette of loaning money to friends and family.
item.content:encoded: Our audience shares their perspective on the tricky etiquette of loaning money to friends and family.
item.dc:creator: Malaka Gharib

item.title: Criminal charges are dropped against top-ranked golfer Scottie Scheffler
item.description: Scheffler was charged with assaulting a police officer with his vehicle in Louisville, Ky., during the PGA Championship. The golfer has said he misunderstood the commands coming from traffic officers.
item.content:encoded:
Scheffler was charged with assaulting a police officer with his vehicle in Louisville, Ky., during the PGA Championship. The golfer has said he misunderstood the commands coming from traffic officers.

(Image credit: Matt York)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: The Negro Leagues are officially part of MLB history — with the records to prove it
item.description: The MLB incorporated the statistics of some 2,300 Black athletes who played in the segregated Negro Leagues between 1920 and 1948, making the late Josh Gibson its new all-time batting leader.
item.content:encoded:
The MLB incorporated the statistics of some 2,300 Black athletes who played in the segregated Negro Leagues between 1920 and 1948, making the late Josh Gibson its new all-time batting leader.

(Image credit: Mark Rucker)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Final words in Trump's hush money trial; South Africans vote in a crucial election
item.description: The jury in Trump’s New York trial begins deliberations. South Africans head to the polls in an election that could bring the biggest shift since the end of apartheid.
item.content:encoded:
The jury in Trump’s New York trial begins deliberations. South Africans head to the polls in an election that could bring the biggest shift since the end of apartheid.

(Image credit: Charly Triballeau)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen
